input_text.Prompt:
Qualcomm on Thursday launched three Snapdragon processors designed to bolster camera, video and gaming in smartphones. The company also rolled out the Snapdragon Wear 2100 system on a chip for new wearable devices.

The trio of Snapdragon chips include the 625, 435 and 425 and the aim is to support LTE, new connectivity standards like 802.11ac and the latest camera image sensors. There's also tools to connect to sensors as well as quick charging technology.

According to Qualcomm, the 625 is the highest end of the trio and supports latest LTE speed as well as high resolution cameras. The 425 is the entry level chip with the 435 falling in the middle.

Snapdragon Wear is a platform that aims to power the latest Android Wear watches and expand from there. Snapdragon Wear includes processor, software, support and reference designs to target everything from health trackers to fashion to mobile devices.

The Snapdragon Wear 2100 is 30 percent smaller than the Snapdragon 400 has 25 percent less power and enables more sensors.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A:
Sure, here is a summary of the given text:

South Korea is developing robots to detect and remove mines in the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) after a recent landmine attack that injured two soldiers. The military plans to develop 170 robots for the task and will begin the project in 2017, with an estimated budget of less than 500 billion won ($431 million). The robots will be used for rear-area operations, including handling explosives and removing landmines buried in the DMZ. Additionally, the military plans to develop 100 unmanned vehicles for DMZ search operations.

Sure! Here is a summary of the information in short words and simple language:

Qualcomm made new chips for phones and watches. The chips help take good pictures and videos, play games, and charge fast. There are three kinds of chips: big, middle, and small. The big one is for fancy phones, the middle one is for most phones, and the small one is for simple watches. The watch chips are special because they can do lots of things like track your health and look good on your wrist.
